label: 惣
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: Self-governing village organizations dating from the fourteenth century. They oversaw matters of a purely local nature, such as self-defense, irrigation and water control, and land management. Some, especially in central Japan, became the local unit on which peasant movements such as ikki, campaigns for peasant control of tax collection, etc., were based.　[一揆]
